perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement will be governed by the substantive laws of the State of New York, without regard for its conflict of laws provisions.
Waiver of Jury Trial
The parties waive any right to a jury trial in any proceeding arising out of or related to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement will be governed by the substantive laws of the State of New York, without regard for its conflict of laws provisions.
Waiver of Jury Trial
Each party retains the right to a jury trial in any proceeding arising out of or related to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The clause explicitly waiving the right to a jury trial is directly contradicted by granting the right. This introduces substantial ambiguity and potential unenforceability regarding the dispute resolution process.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 7th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution and general contract law principles regarding waiver.

perturbation.original_text: In no event will either party be liable to the other for special, incidental, or indirect damages or for any consequential damages (including lost profits or savings), even if they are informed of the possibility; provided that this Section 10.0 does not apply to Customer’s failure to pay any amounts owing to IBM under this Agreement (including amounts owing for Services that would have been rendered but for Customer’s breach of this Agreement).
perturbation.changed_text: In no event will either party be liable to the other for special, incidental, or indirect damages or for any consequential damages (including lost profits or savings), even if they are informed of the possibility. Notwithstanding the above, either party will be liable to the other for special, incidental, or indirect damages or for any consequential damages (including lost profits or savings), even if they are not informed of the possibility.
perturbation.explanation: The clause initially disclaims liability for consequential damages but then directly contradicts itself by stating that either party WILL be liable for such damages, regardless of prior notice. This creates fundamental confusion as to the scope of liability and makes the clause difficult to interpret or enforce.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding limitation of liability and clarity in contractual terms.

perturbation.original_text:
Actions Period
Neither party will bring a legal action related to this Agreement more than two years after the cause of action accrued.
perturbation.changed_text:
Actions Period
Neither party will bring a legal action related to this Agreement more than two years after the cause of action accrued. 
Actions can be brought about at anytime deemed reasonable to either party.
perturbation.explanation: The clause initially limits the time to bring a legal action to two years but then directly contradicts itself by stating actions can be brought at anytime deemed reasonable. This introduces substantial ambiguity and potential unenforceability regarding the dispute resolution process.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Statute of Limitations, General contract law principles regarding limitation of liability and clarity in contractual terms.
